paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on a novel KCNH2 variant associated with congenital heart defects and long QT syndrome.

patients.phenotype: long QT syndrome combined with tetralogy of fallot

individual_records.phenotype_details: long QT syndrome and congenital heart defects including tetralogy of fallot
individual_records.evidence_sentence: In conclusion, our study described an additional case of LQT2 combined with tetralogy of fallot in a fetus with a KCNH2 mutation.
the KCNH2 mutation in the fetus was inherited from her mother, who had no obvious cardiac phenotype.

functional_data.summary: The mutation is predicted to affect protein structure/function.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with the disease in the family.
variants.population_frequency: No frequency was found in the databases of gnomAD, 1,000 genomes, dbSNP, and ExAC.
variants.evidence_level: PVS1, PM2_Supporting according to ACMG guidelines.
variants.additional_notes: The mutation was classified as a likely pathogenic variant according to ACMG guidelines.
key_quotes: A novel nonsense mutation of c.1907C > G (p.S636*) in the KCNH2 gene was identified in the fetus by WES technology, which was inherited from the mother and further confirmed by Sanger sequencing.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the KCNH2 variant was successfully extracted.
